sub_title: Afghanistan, Iraq, Yemen, Balkans | Conflict Sensitive Programming | Advisor Fragile States | Policy Engagement | Fundraiser
summary: 25 years experience on international development in fragile states: Kosovo, North-Macedonia, Georgia, DRC, Rwanda, Afghanistan, Iraq, Yemen, Jordan, Lebanon, Mali and Burkina Faso. I am passionate to make a difference for people in fragile states. I translate context analysis into conflict-sensitive high impact strategies that combine program, advocacy and publicity. I raised funds for more than €45M, managed multiple multi-annual programs including consortia, and managed teams up to 30 people. Experienced with policy engagement, advocacy and diplomacy, on sensitive files, at a very senior level. I am an inspiring and result-oriented coach and team leader. I have published on conflict in Kosovo, North-Macedonia, DRC and Afghanistan, spoke on radio, TV and international conferences on Kosovo, North-Macedonia, Afghanistan, Iraq and Syria. Until October 2021 I was Program Manager for Iraq and Yemen, and conflict-sensitivity  advisor for Afghanistan, Mali and Burkina Faso. Since December 2021 I am Partnership and Programme Developer at NUFFIC. I am guest lecturer at universities and think tanks. The experience of living in North-Macedonia, Afghanistan and Iraq during armed conflict inspires me. After university I followed courses humanitarian negotiations, conflict analysis, international security, international humanitarian law, and media training.

treasury_media.title: Pope Francis visits Iraq: "let's focus on his message of tolerance and hope" by Albert van Hal of Cordaid
treasury_media.description: Despite a recent outbreak of violence and restrictions due to COVID-19, Pope Francis will arrive in Iraq today for a tour of the country.

treasury_media.title: Cordaid in Uruzgan: Promoting healthcare in a war - Interview with Albert van Hal and Hameed Attaiy
treasury_media.description: Despite the odds of war, Uruzgan’s health care system is getting better and stronger. Has Cordaid’s 2001-2018 commitment in the Afghan province anything to do with this encouraging fact? And how did we stick to …

treasury_media.title: Why nonstate armed groups allow access for health workers - interview with advisors on humanitarian aid
treasury_media.description: Stamping out diseases means health groups sometimes have to provide vaccines and other essential services in areas controlled by armed groups. Devex speaks to experts about how it works.

Afghanistan, Iraq, Yemen, Balkans | Conflict Sensitive Programming | Advisor Fragile States | Policy Engagement | Fundraiser

profile_positions.description: At VNG International (International Co-operation Agency of the Association of Netherlands Municipalities) I am responsible for programs to support local government in Tunisia and Libya.
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Develop new programmes on higher education, TVET and employability for Jordan, Lebanon, Iraq and Afghanistan.
Coordinate Nuffic's process of EU Pillar Assessment: adhere to EU rules of compliance.
profile_positions.title: Partnerships & Programmes Developer

profile_positions.description: Start a program in 2017 on healthcare that is mostly on Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS) and response to Gender Based Violence (GBV) in Iraq. Also manage its fast growth: develop business among different international donors (€9M), advocate, initiate and supervise research and publicity; in consultation with donors, NGOs, ministries, UN and research institutes / universities. Pioneer projects on MHPSS, durable return and social cohesion. At the start of 2021 the program has expanded to 9 locations in 5 governates of Iraq. Since 2020 I manage a program and a team of 7 on healthcare in Yemen. I manage the relationships with Yemeni NGOs. I initiate & supervise research, manage donor relations and am expanding the program with new projects.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Iraq and Yemen

profile_positions.description:
Conflict Sensitivity Analysis on Afghanistan for Netherlands Enterprise Agency: submit and negotiate ToR, lead team, write and present report.
Lead design of conflict-sensitive strategy and program for Sahel: 2 weeks travel, lead participatory strategy-workshops, debrief and final report.
profile_positions.title: Conflict Sensitivity Advisor

profile_positions.description: Design and implement in-country and international advocacy for sustainable healthcare in Afghanistan and DRC a.o. by speaking at international conferences, appearing in media, initiating publicity, teaching courses, meeting ministers, MPs and ambassadors, advising national NGOs and Country Offices. Start a program in 2017 on healthcare in Iraq that is mostly on Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS) and response to Gender Based Violence (GBV). Also manage its fast growth: develop business among different international donors (€9M), advocate, initiate and supervise research and publicity; in consultation with donors, NGOs, ministries, UN and research institutes / universities. Pioneer new projects on MHPSS, durable return and social cohesion. In December 2020 the program is in 9 locations in 5 governates of Iraq. Since 2020 I manage a program and a team of 7 on healthcare in Yemen. I manage relations with Yemeni NGOs, initiate & supervise research and manage donor relations. I am expanding the program with new projects. (The advocacy for DRC and Afghanistan takes halftime. Program Management for Middle East takes halftime too).
profile_positions.title: Advocacy Coordinator & Program Manager Iraq and Yemen

profile_positions.description: Design and implement in-country and international advocacy for sustainable healthcare in Afghanistan and DRC a.o. by speaking at international conferences, appearing in media, initiating publicity, teaching courses, meeting ministers, MPs and ambassadors, advising national NGOS and Country Offices. It is part of the Strategic Partnership with the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and is called Dialogue and Dissent.
profile_positions.title: Advocacy Coordinator Afghanistan and DRC

profile_positions.description: As Country Director I managed 30 staff of Cordaid Country Office in Kabul and a program of €18M annually. I was in charge of the design of the strategy and the annual plan. Under my leadership the Country Office achieved €6M business development in 2014 for different new programs. As representative of Cordaid I advocated at the Afghan government and the International Community on a very senior level through bilateral meetings, but also through speeches and articles. I was spokesperson for radio, TV and other media.
profile_positions.title: Country Director Afghanistan

profile_positions.description: Introduction of a coherent long term conflict-sensitive and high impact strategy that combines program, advocacy and publicity. It brought prominence to the Afghanistan program inside and outside Cordaid. Responsible for Cordaid's multi-million dollar program, including extensive travel to Uruzgan, Kandahar, Balkh. Responsible for acquisition: achieved €33 M in fundraising. At the ministers request member of a panel advising Dutch private sector on business initiatives in Afghanistan. Liaise with Dutch government, parliament and military. Public awareness raising through speeches at conferences and guest lectures at universities and think tanks. Spokesperson for radio, TV, writing articles for magazines.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager Afghanistan

profile_positions.description: Advise national and international NGOs on advocacy in field of international co-operation; especially on peace, security and human rights. Acquisition: identify, based on political analysis, new developments in peace and security and advise NGOs on their strategies to translate new developments into lobby/advocacy. Examples include dialogue with Islamic movements, natural resources in the Great Lakes area (Central Africa), religion and conflict.  Chef de mission for Dutch monitors in Congo DR parliamentary and presidential elections in July 2006.
profile_positions.title: Advisor

profile_positions.description: Design, introduce and manage new conflict resolution programmes based on continuous political analysis of conflict regions, including acquisition, lobby and advocacy through speeches, newspaper articles, and radio-interviews. Developed expertise in religion and conflict, media and conflict,  inter-ethnic relations and decentralization.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager Balkans

profile_positions.description: Establish local NGO in Gostivar (North-Macedonia) to address inter-ethnic tensions through acquisition at donor agencies.  Worked with local Albanian, Macedonian and Turkish civic organizations in times of interethnic conflict.  Analysis of conflict causes and policy design and implementation, including Media & Conflict, Religion & Conflict, and decentralization.  Local and international media outreach.  Liaise with international NGOs and diplomatic missions on conflict resolution policies.
profile_positions.title: International Advisor

profile_positions.description: The Hague Appeal for Peace was a worldwide coalition of NGOs that organized a major peace conference in The Hague on the occasion of the 100th anniversary of the First Hague Peace Conference. I managed 20 international staff and 180 volunteers during the conference, raised funds and built contacts with international governments and NGOs.
profile_positions.title: Co-ordinator
